articles.title: Nvidia unveils new Cosmos world models, infra for robotics and physical uses
articles.description: Nvidia on Monday unveiled a set of new world AI models, libraries, and other infrastructure for robotics developers, most notable of which is Cosmos Reason, a 7-billion-parameter "reasoning" vision language model for physical AI applications and robots.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak
articles.content: Nvidia on Monday unveiled a set of new world AI models, libraries, and other infrastructure for robotics developers, most notable of which is Cosmos Reason, a 7-billion-parameter "reasoning" vision language model for physical AI applications and robots.

articles.title: Open Weights and AI for All
articles.description: AI’s next frontier isn’t just about capability—it’s about who gets to use it. Our mission to put AI in the hands of as many people as possible is what drives us. Today’s release of our most capable open-weights models is a major step forward that makes advanced AI more open, flexible, and accessible worldwide.
articles.content: AI’s next frontier isn’t just about capability—it’s about who gets to use it. Our mission to put AI in the hands of as many people as possible is what drives us. Today’s release of our most capable open-weights models is a major step forward that makes advanced AI more open, flexible, and accessible worldwide.

articles.title: The backlash against Duolingo going ‘AI-first’ didn’t even matter
articles.description: Duolingo faced significant backlash for announcing that it would become an "AI-first" company -- and yet, the app posted strong financials this quarter.
articles.author: Amanda Silberling

articles.title: New Report: The Architectural Patterns of Financial AI
articles.description: At Bankwell Bank, a new employee named Sarah works around the clock. She responds to loan applicants via email and SMS in under three minutes, gathers missing documents, and hands a perfectly structured file to her human colleagues. articles.title: Why Prompt Injection Still Works
articles.description: LLMsAnd How to Catch It Before It’s Too LateHidden Layer made the headlines recently as its universal prompt bypassed over 20 LLMs. No fine-tuning. No guesswork. Just a single, well-crafted prompt is what it takes to break almost every major AI model, including your favorite GPTs, Geminis, Sonnets, and Llamas. The prompt triggered the models to provide helpful advice on topics such as enriching and selling uranium, DIY bomb-making, or methamphetamine production.As LLMs are being embedded into...
articles.author: Michał Oleszak

articles.title: InfiGUI-G1: Advancing GUI Grounding with Adaptive Exploration Policy Optimization
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05731v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The emergence of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) has propelled the development of autonomous agents that operate on Graphical User Interfaces (GUIs) using pure visual input. A fundamental challenge is robustly grounding natural language instructions. This requires a precise spatial alignment, which accurately locates the coordinates of each element, and, more critically, a correct semantic alignment, which matches the instructions to the...

articles.title: A variational approach to dimension-free self-normalized concentration
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06483v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the self-normalized concentration of vector-valued stochastic processes. We focus on bounds for sub-$\psi$ processes, a tail condition that encompasses a wide variety of well-known distributions (including sub-exponential, sub-Gaussian, sub-gamma, and sub-Poisson distributions). Our results recover and generalize the influential bound of Abbasi-Yadkori et al. (2011) and fill a gap in the literature between determinant-based bounds and...
articles.author: Ben Chugg, Aaditya Ramdas
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06483v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the self-normalized concentration of vector-valued stochastic processes. We focus on bounds for sub-$\psi$ processes, a tail condition that encompasses a wide variety of well-known distributions (including sub-exponential, sub-Gaussian, sub-gamma, and sub-Poisson distributions). Our results recover and generalize the influential bound of Abbasi-Yadkori et al. (2011) and fill a gap in the literature between determinant-based bounds and...

articles.title: Bayesian Gaussian Process ODEs via Double Normalizing Flows
articles.description: arXiv:2309.09222v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Recently, Gaussian processes have been used to model the vector field of continuous dynamical systems, referred to as GPODEs, which are characterized by a probabilistic ODE equation. Bayesian inference for these models has been extensively studied and applied in tasks such as time series prediction. However, the use of standard GPs with basic kernels like squared exponential kernels has been common in GPODE research, limiting the model's...

articles.title: Optimal Linear Baseline Models for Scientific Machine Learning
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05831v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Across scientific domains, a fundamental challenge is to characterize and compute the mappings from underlying physical processes to observed signals and measurements. While nonlinear neural networks have achieved considerable success, they remain theoretically opaque, which hinders adoption in contexts where interpretability is paramount. In contrast, linear neural networks serve as a simple yet effective foundation for gaining insight into these...
articles.author: Alexander DeLise, Kyle Loh, Krish Patel, Meredith Teague, Andrea Arnold, Matthias Chung

articles.title: Lightweight Auto-bidding based on Traffic Prediction in Live Advertising
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06069v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Internet live streaming is widely used in online entertainment and e-commerce, where live advertising is an important marketing tool for anchors. An advertising campaign hopes to maximize the effect (such as conversions) under constraints (such as budget and cost-per-click). The mainstream control of campaigns is auto-bidding, where the performance depends on the decision of the bidding algorithm in each request. The most widely used auto-bidding...
articles.author: Bo Yang, Ruixuan Luo, Junqi Jin, Han Zhu
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06069v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Internet live streaming is widely used in online entertainment and e-commerce, where live advertising is an important marketing tool for anchors. articles.title: Optimization-Free Style Transfer for 3D Gaussian Splats
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05813v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The task of style transfer for 3D Gaussian splats has been explored in many previous works, but these require reconstructing or fine-tuning the splat while incorporating style information or optimizing a feature extraction network on the splat representation. We propose a reconstruction- and optimization-free approach to stylizing 3D Gaussian splats. This is done by generating a graph structure across the implicit surface of the splat...
articles.author: Raphael Du Sablon, David Hart
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05813v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The task of style transfer for 3D Gaussian splats has been explored in many previous works, but these require reconstructing or fine-tuning the splat while incorporating style information or optimizing a feature extraction network on the splat representation. We propose a reconstruction- and optimization-free approach to stylizing 3D Gaussian splats. This is done by generating a graph structure across the implicit surface of the splat...

articles.title: Adaptive Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks: Bridging Heterophily and Heterogeneity
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06034v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Heterogeneous graphs (HGs) are common in real-world scenarios and often exhibit heterophily. However, most existing studies focus on either heterogeneity or heterophily in isolation, overlooking the prevalence of heterophilic HGs in practical applications. Such ignorance leads to their performance degradation. In this work, we first identify two main challenges in modeling heterophily HGs: (1) varying heterophily distributions across hops and...
articles.author: Qin Chen, Guojie Song
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06034v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Heterogeneous graphs (HGs) are common in real-world scenarios and often exhibit heterophily. However, most existing studies focus on either heterogeneity or heterophily in isolation, overlooking the prevalence of heterophilic HGs in practical applications. Such ignorance leads to their performance degradation. In this work, we first identify two main challenges in modeling heterophily HGs: (1) varying heterophily distributions across hops and...

articles.title: LinguaFluid: Language Guided Fluid Control via Semantic Rewards in Reinforcement Learning
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05977v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In the domain of scientific machine learning, designing effective reward functions remains a challenge in reinforcement learning (RL), particularly in environments where task goals are difficult to specify numerically. Reward functions in existing work are predominantly based on heuristics, manual engineering, or task-specific tuning. In this work, we introduce a semantically aligned reinforcement learning method where rewards are computed by...

articles.title: Pruning the Unsurprising: Efficient Code Reasoning via First-Token Surprisal
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05988v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recently, Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in code reasoning by scaling up the length of Chain-of-Thought (CoT). However, excessively long reasoning traces introduce substantial challenges in terms of training cost, inference latency, and deployment feasibility. While various CoT compression approaches have emerged to address this challenge, they face inherent trade-offs: token-level methods often disrupt...
articles.author: Wenhao Zeng, Yaoning Wang, Chao Hu, Yuling Shi, Chengcheng Wan, Hongyu Zhang, Xiaodong Gu
